intro: Silene choruhensis, commonly known as the Choruh Mountains catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Eastern Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom during the summer months. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in the harsh, arid conditions of its mountainous habitat. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, Silene choruhensis is considered a rare and endemic species.
